title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 567.1 - Statement of policy
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 567.1 - Statement of policy

State Regulations

It is the policy of the State of New York to recognize and
reward management/confidential employees (M/C's) whose significant individual
or team achievements go beyond the scope of normal duties or performance. The
purpose of the Special Achievement Awards program is to serve as a positive
motivator for M/C's and thereby encourage initiative, innovation, productivity
improvement, and monetary savings in New York State. This is intended to be a
highly selective program in which less than one percent of the M/C group will
be selected as award recipients each year. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
567.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
